description: From Latin recoctus, past participle of recoquere (“to cook or boil over again”). See re- and cook.

verbs.description: recoct (third-person singular simple present recocts, present participle recocting, simple past and past participle recocted)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To boil or cook again.
(obsolete, transitive, by extension) To make over; to revamp or reconstruct.
